Cr1.MC.No.5222 OF 2020(C)
AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CMP 2067/2020 DATED 06-11-2020 OF
JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, PARAVUR
CRIME NO.515/2018 OF PARAVOOR POLICE STATION, KOLLAM

NITHIN, AGED 35 YEARS,

RESPONDENTS/STATE AND COMPLAINANT:
1 STATE OF KERALA
REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF
KERALA, ERNAKULAM.
2 THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER,
PARAVUR POLICE STATION, PARAVUR P.O,KOLLAM DISTRICT.
PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.K.B.UDAYAKUMAR
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON
06.01.2021, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

ORs te
Cr1.MC.No.5222 OF 2020(C) 2 2021/KER/788
ORDER

The accused No.6 who was enlarged on bail by
imposing conditions including surrender of the
passport came up before this court, aggrieved by an
order by the learned Magistrate refusing to release
the passport, so as to enable him to leave the state.
It will not come under the purview of Section 482
Cr.P.C.. The remedy lies somewhere else. Instead of
exhausting the remedy available to the party, the
petitioner came up with an application under Section
482 Cr.P.C. Without prejudice to the right of
parties to exhaust the proper remedy as per the lux
fori and lux loci, the Crl.M.C. is dismissed. Return
the certified copy of Annexure A3 to the concerned

counsel on proper application forthwith.

Sd/-

P. SOMARAJAN
JUDGE
msp
